definition: opening (chess etc)/early stage of game, match, work, activity etc

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
office/situation/classifier for games: match, set, round etc
Closed Game/Double Queen Pawn Opening (chess)/same as 雙后前兵開局|双后前兵开局
Double Queen Pawn Opening/Closed Game (chess)/same as 封閉性開局|封闭性开局
pinyin: shuang1 hou4 qian2 bing1 kai1 ju2

sentences.english: A pretty low starting point and as far as Alana was concerned, one that could only get better – and it did.
sentences.chinese: 開局不妙，而且就阿拉娜而言，應該做得更好一點。

sentences.english: This is my"legal"mentality intheface of society discomposure start.
sentences.chinese: 這是我以“法律”心態面對社會的狼狽開局。

sentences.english: In Go, however, beginning to program and making progress are both very difficult.
sentences.chinese: 然而，在圍棋中，開局和行棋都非常困難。

sentences.english: This year kicks off the second decade in the new century. The 10 years that has just passed is a decade of crisis and transformation, and of cooperation and development.
sentences.chinese: 今年是新世紀第二個十年的開局之年。

sentences.english: Hodgson's future at Liverpool has come under intense scrutiny following a disastrous start to the season.
sentences.chinese: 賽季開局慘淡，霍奇森在安菲爾德的未來備受關注。

sentences.english: This season they made their worst start in 89 years of league football.
sentences.chinese: 本賽季龐貝的開局是球隊89年聯賽征戰史上最差的。

sentences.english: This good start has laid the groundwork for the further growth of China-U.S. relations.
sentences.chinese: 這一良好開局爲新時期中美關係的發展奠定了基礎。

sentences.english: His beginning position was stylized Sicily Defence.
sentences.chinese: 他以西西里防禦的程式開局。

sentences.english: We have had a tough start and a bad start with results.
sentences.chinese: 我們開局很艱難，結局就更苦逼。

sentences.english: Where can I watch Gambit movie online free full stream?
sentences.chinese: 我在哪裏可以在線看電影免費開局充分流？

sentences.english: It was the best start to August trading since 1934.
sentences.chinese: 這是1934年以來8月份最好的股市開局。

sentences.english: 2011 will begin sluggishly without passions and love.
sentences.chinese: 2011年將以沒有激情和愛情平淡開局。

sentences.english: On Tirol, too, things were off to a shaky start.
sentences.chinese: 泰洛星上也是開局不利。

sentences.english: The Sixers lost their first 15 games before beating the Houston Rockets.
sentences.chinese: 76人在擊敗休斯頓火箭之前他們開局15連敗。
西班牙開局，開放，古典防禦。

sentences.english: The Rockets hope to do the same while jumping out to their best start in more than a decade.
sentences.chinese: 火箭隊也希望能攻善守，打出10多年來最好的開局。

definition: bitter struggle/hard battle/arduous effort
a good beginning
powerful enemy
to turn back/to reverse
to break a record/record-breaking
to prepare/to make adequate preparation
to make a comeback/(of a doctor's assessment of the gender of a fetus) to turn out to be wrong
to defend the crown (in sports championship)
first round (of a competition etc)
to leave a place where some event is taking place/(of an actor) to exit/(sports) to leave the field/(of an audience) to leave
preliminary competition/to hold preliminary heats
to turn defeat into victory (idiom); to turn the tide
military successes/(fig.) success/accomplishment
to win by a narrow margin/to barely win/narrow victory
to follow up a victory and press home the attack/to pursue retreating enemy
exhibition game
